author: Colin Bowles
title: WVU Loses Overtime Thriller
text:
WVU Loses Overtime Thriller - WVVA TV Bluefield Beckley WV News, Weather and Sports Member Center: Follow @ColinxBowles MORGANTOWN, WV - 
West Virginia came into Saturdays game looking to avoid dropping their second game in a row but were unsuccessful as they fell to Oklahoma State, 33-26 in overtime. 
Skyler Howard brought West Virginia back from 15 points down with a scoring run with 2:44 left to send the game into overtime tied at 26. 
Oklahoma State received the ball first in Overtime and scored off of a J.W. Walsh scramble to take the lead. The Mountaineers advanced the ball down the field and on a 4 th and goal, Howard aired it out and ended up incomplete. 
Howard finished 18 of 35 for 188 yards and a TD. Wendell Smallwood tied his career high with 147 yards on the ground and one Touchdown. 
West Virginia will travel to Texas on Saturday to face the second ranked Baylor Bears.
